DOC.brief_summary: Three types of workers exposed to different levels of natural sunlight will be tested for Vitamin D blood level, PTH, Ca, P, albumin and alkaline phosphatase. In addition, each tested worker will be asked to fill a questionnaire for demographic, medical and personal habit information.
DOC.brief_title: Impact of Work Environment Absent of Natural Light on Vitamin D Levels
DOC.criteria: people employed in their current work place at least 6 months, people who consume food additives containing Vitamin D. people who have a chronic illness which harms the Vitamin D absorption, such as Celiac, chronic Pancreatitis, Cystic Fibrosis and IBS. people who have a chronic illness which harms Vitamin D metabolism, such as chronic hepatitis, kidney insufficiency and Nephrotic Syndrome. pregnant women. people who require prescribed medicine like steroids, anticonvulsion, and HIV treatments.
